website_summaries.verdict: Don't let the small dimensions fool you – this kids’ cleaning set is about as realistic and sturdy as they come. Ideal for little ones looking for grown-up tools in a kid-friendly design.
pros: Classic design mimics real cleaning tools right down to the last detail
Comes with everything necessary for kiddos to help parents clean up or play on their own
Includes mop, broom, duster, dustpan, and brush
Comes with a stand to keep things neat and tidy
cons: A bit of rough handling or pulling can cause the hanging rack tip over

customer_reviews.title: Bad design - could damage floors
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves to sweep the floor so I thought this would be a great little cleaning set for her. I love Melissa and Doug products. And it really is nice for the most part. But there’s one thing that takes off major points for me. The bottom of the mop has a hard plastic disc with a screw that could really do some damage to our hardwood floors. I definitely expect more from Melissa and Doug.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Katie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for children learning and child development.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for Boys and girls my grandson wanted to help me clean and the very first time he helped sweep he found a diamond earring that was lost. It payed for itself the first time used. We got lucky and he has not forgotten and it promotes great learning and children development. Well made of smooth wood no sharp edges. Definitely recommend Thanks for Reading Reviews Help Consumers
customer_reviews.author: joeyangel510

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but with a design flaw
customer_reviews.text: My 3yo loves this. It's me that finds a design problem irritating. The stand comes as 2 separate pieces, you screw the pole into the base. The problem is a 3yo who consistently and constantly unscrews them, leaving the pieces in various places. An easy fix would be for it to come with a screw that's placed into the pole base going into the main base. So once you assemble it, the screw would keep it together. Or just have a kid who doesn't have a desire to deconstruct everything! There is a little hole that I believe is supposed to "lock" the pieces together. It does no such thing.
customer_reviews.author: 3LittleFish

customer_reviews.title: ... dance with but he loves it nonetheless and its pretty adorable so I have no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Son prefers to take everything off stand and use it (the stand) as a microphone to sing and dance with but he loves it nonetheless and its pretty adorable so I have no complaints. Everything is also very well made, everything is "standing up" to my son who thinks he is a rockstar.
customer_reviews.author: ColeTan

customer_reviews.title: Take advantage of their love of cleaning while you can!
customer_reviews.text: Love these type of toys that teach kids to do chores in a fun way. It trains them to become responsible adults. I knew it was time to get this for our toddler when he kept taking away the Swiffer from me and trying to clean our floors. He was happy to clean the pine needles that kept falling from our Christmas tree.
customer_reviews.author: mkysayTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that the wooden handle felt sandy and gritty. Not like completely unfinished plywood that you'd get a splinter. But it is definitely unfinished wood! I rolled the broom around on top of a fuzzy blanket to test how unfinished it - the entire handle from top to bottom pulled out pieces of my blanket. No way I'm giving this to my child to play with. I'm normally a huge Melissa & Doug fan, But this is a real serious fail.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo f

customer_reviews.title: Great pretend-play toy! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot tell you how many times my kids have played with these. They are two years old, so that gives you an idea of how tall they are compared to them. When your toddlers are in that stage of wanting to do everything you're doing...these are great. When I'm trying to sweep the floor and they're begging to grab the broom, I tell them they have their own brooms they can use and they run and grab their own. These are something they'll be able to play with for at least a few more years too. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Robin Brzezinski

customer_reviews.title: A favorite at our house!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy! I wonder if the manufacturer has read some of these reviews and made some recent improvements to the product? I say this because I have not had any problems with the mop shedding (or any other quality/ sturdiness issues,) and this receives very heavy daily play from my son. The one I got is great!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney N

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: We bought this 1 and a half years ago and my daughters loved it! Quality of the cleaning tools is great. However, the pole started loosening from the base about 6 months ago and has just gotten worse. Adding a washer didn't help and it won't fully tighten anymore so the whole thing sits sideways and falls over when they take anything off.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: sparks a toddlers creative side
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and life like. Your toddler may surprise you by dunking the mop in the dogs water bowl and cleaning your entire kitchen while you attempted to use the bathroom, for once, in peace. Additionally the little broom is great for brushing both the dog and the cat and then attempting to use as a toothbrush. When not in actual use these are great for strewing around any active walkway to trip adults. As a parent you may find yourself reaching for these here and there to actually use because they are really like the real thing. Highly recommend ! (no kidding this a nice cleaning set).
customer_reviews.author: Jd chester springs

customer_reviews.title: Great for pretend cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my 18 month old twins because they like our broom. I gave it 5 stars because it's really cute and my twins love it. It says 3 years and up, so be warned and it is may not be appropriate for younger children. Although my twins love it, I took away the feather duster because they were chewing on it and it was coming apart. They're not interested in the little sweeper and dust pan, but love the broom and mop and 'clean' the playroom. They also like the stand, and enjoy taking the broom and mop off the stand and hanging them back on when finished.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: My son loves to clean with these!
customer_reviews.text: Update- Melissa and Doug customer service reached out to me and mailed me a new stand. This stand is not warped and looks great so I'm switching my review to 5 stars. My son loves this so much. He has had this you for about 8 months now and plays with it daily. He is always "cleaning up a mess". The only reason that I knocked off a star is because the pole that they hang on arrived warped and has gotten worse over the last few months, but that doesn't impact the fun my son has with them so it isn't a huge deal!
customer_reviews.author: Heather CTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: The quality is great. I have two issues though
customer_reviews.text: My son is 14 months and he loves his cleaning set. The quality is great. I have two issues though. Since my son is 14 months, he likes to use the items as weapons and they hurt because their very sturdy. :) The second issue is that he doesn't quite understand how to remove the items from the rack because they hang from strings. Other than that, I love this item and hope you will too.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos alcala

customer_reviews.title: It's built strong like toys from the 50's
customer_reviews.text: This is the exception to the "they don't build things like they used to" complaint we have about so many things. I was blown away at the quality. This the perfect toy for my daughter. She loves helping her mommy clean and this set is great for that. The quality is great and built with sturdy wood, soft cotton on the bristles of the broom and mop head, the stand is well built and sturdy and even the box it came in was adorable. My daughter loves this set and I recommend it as an inexpensive yet impressive gift for the little helper in your life :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: so I thought this would be the perfect Easter gift
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is currently obsessed with playing with my broom and swiffer, so I thought this would be the perfect Easter gift. He absolutely loves it, but unfortunately the broom came apart less than 2 days after he received it. I would return it, but we already threw away the packaging. Looks like I'm stuck trying to glue it back together instead. We have purchased many other Melissa and Doug toys and are really disappointed in the quality of this item. I would recommend purchasing a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Broken product and no response from M&D
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my 18 month old son because he loves to sweep just like he sees me do. He had the set for about 1 week and the broom handle broke in half. Very unsafe and he was not even playing rough with it. We have several Melissa and Doug products, and have been happy with the quality. I am very disappointed with this. What is even worse is that when I reached out to the company to send me a replacement they never responded.
customer_reviews.author: AndreaZ

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the intent behind the product, love that it's cute and encourages imaginative play. My 1 year old son loves it. My complaint is that the wood is rough. It feels like plywood bought straight from home depot with no finish or oil added. It's dry and slightly splintering. I added wood oil for now and I'm going to sand later and reoil. But for a $30 kids toy I shouldn't have to fix the product to make it safe for my son.
customer_reviews.author: meeks

customer_reviews.title: Makes me wish I was a kid again!
customer_reviews.text: Arrives in Melissa and Doug box, perfect for gifting. Set is colorful, wood nicely sanded, no roughness. Stand for organizing mop, duster, broom, dust pan is sturdy. Perfect set. Instructions are clear, seem unnecessary, but legally to cover their company probably required. Additional fun tips ridiculous. Use dust pan as a ramp. It's all of an inch high. Use duster as a microphone. In this time of Covid-19 I wouldn't encouraged anything with dust, dirt, germs near a mouth. Improvement: Instead of string loops to attach tools to stand perhaps something that holds it shape open for little hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou C

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: After surrendering the full-size broom to our 2.5 year old for the umpteenth time, decided that we had passed the point of cute and it was getting a bit dangerous with him wielding the handle around the house. Found this on sale and everyone in the house is thrilled. It's amazing how much our son loves this cleaning set. It's well made and the perfect size for toddlers. We're still working on getting him to hang the tools back on the stand but the fact they are constantly in use is a testament to the appeal of this set. Waiting for Melissa & Doug to release a working mini vacuum now.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Missing key component!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this specifically to teach my 16 month old very busy grandson about “chores” .... especially sweeping! He likes to help! Well, unfortunately the DUSTPAN is missing in this set. I am very disappointed. I must have paid full price for someone’s return! I am not going through the return hassle as I would have to increase my exposure to Covid 19. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Russell

customer_reviews.title: Toddler enjoys, one tweak would help
customer_reviews.text: My toddler (2.5yo) loves to “clean” with these. They are cute and affordable. The placement and/or length of the strings that the tools hang up on their holder with could be improved. The strings are too short for how far down the hole is on the stick. It’s difficult for me to hang them up (have to angle the stick away from the holder, slide string on, then allow stick to drop and hang down). This gets very frustrating for my toddler. He wants to hang them up himself and it is very difficult each time. Lengthen the string a bit and little hands will be able to slip the strings into their holders.
customer_reviews.author: Meesh

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, better for 2-3 kids together
customer_reviews.text: Durable materials and well made. But I bought it too early for my 3-year-old, after seeing so many positive reviews. My son wasn't too excited about it although he did show interest in sweeping the floor prior. He still plays with our real broom and mop from time to time. We ended it up giving this set to another family with two kids, who like it much better because they can team up and do a cleaning activity together. I think it's much more fun when multiple kids get to work together and then switch jobs/equipment for a more realistic cleaning activity.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: It may look like a toy but it also works to help clean.
customer_reviews.text: What better way to teach your children to help with chores than to actually give them the tools that work. I don't know why some kids love to help clean but I will not complain. Our child always wants to help clean but the tools we use are too big of course. This product is a good size for children and it actually works in helping clean the house. It's easy to setup and the cleaning tools are easily accessible. I would easily recommend this since I know all my parental friends have this already. Now if they can only make a vacuum for kids.
customer_reviews.author: R.V.

customer_reviews.title: Fun but WARNING
customer_reviews.text: I want to start by saying our son (2 1/2) LOVES his broom. He loved our house broom, so we got him this for Christmas. If you have a climber... I would either recommend skipping this or recommend getting rid of the base/holder. Our son climbs everything. It was on its side (think upright like a steering wheel) and slipped from under him and he broke his femur. We love Melissa & Doug toys and puzzles, don’t get me wrong. Just wouldn’t recommend if you have a kiddo who likes to climb or stand on things. We live in a very small town and after this happened I heard of similar stories from 3 other moms.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Z

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: My son (21 months) likes to take all the things off the stand. He doesn’t really play with them for more then a few seconds. Then I have to put them all back on the stand for him. It’s a great concept and well made toy. I was hoping it would inspire conversations about mess; not really. For me personally, I’m sick of finding it all over the floor and it might just go in the trash within the next few weeks. I don’t use a mop or broom to clean (I use a swifter and a vacuum) so I’m not sure my kid really finds it that cool.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa K.

customer_reviews.title: Love! Functional and fun.
customer_reviews.text: My preschool kiddos love love love this! They are always asking me to help clean up after snack and I haven’t been comfortable with them using the adult broom. They used wet paper towels behind me but that causes more mess and hazardous wet floors. So, now they can play clean with this set in their own spaces while I quickly sweep and clear tables. Or honestly, they can help me with this functional set. Great buy, and might need a few more so more friends can help! Great tool for teaching about respecting our space, taking care of our things, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Hackmann

customer_reviews.title: My 9.5 month old son’s new favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, he only really cares about the broom... but holy cow does he love that broom! He’ll walk around the house “sweeping” for an hour straight, happy as a clam! He just started walking a couple weeks ago, so I wanted something wooden and sturdy that wouldn’t snap if he stumbled or leaned on it a bit and this definitely delivered. I love that it’s natural wood with no obnoxious colors or cartoons! And the little stand is quite handy. I wish they sold more pieces like this individually so I could add to his set over time. I’d totally buy natural wood (no colors or cartoons) push brooms or rakes and shovels from them. So high quality!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Willemin

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy...until it falls apart
customer_reviews.text: All of the tools are very well built; the bristles, mop head and duster are so functional I've had my toddler clean up several messes he made. However, it doesn't seem like, for how heavy the wood is, that much glue was used to attach the broom head to the handle. We had this set for a week when my 2 year-old brought me the broom in two pieces. It's an easy fix, but I expected better from a Melissa & Doug product.
customer_reviews.author: R Rael

customer_reviews.title: Watch for Splinters
customer_reviews.text: I thought these little tools would be perfect for my 3 year old granddaughter but after using the mop for a few minutes she got a splinter. My son-in-law had to smooth the surfaces on all the tools and stand with sandpaper. I would have thought the quality control would have been better from Melissa and Doug. So check these before giving them to your loved ones.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Engaging "Clean Up" Toys
customer_reviews.text: We're long time supporters of these "real" quality learning and occupational skill toys. Our 5 year old daughter now "helps" mommy and daddy clean up the play room, bed rooms, and family room instinctively with these wonderful made-for-kids heirloom quality wooden children's dust, sweep and mop set. Any small bucket or gently used coffee can completes this set. A proud 5-star review for this toy from us for amazon readers. Thanks to Doug and Melissa too!
customer_reviews.author: James Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my toddler when he kept stealing the broom and dust pan from me, and getting upset when I tried to use it. He loves the broom, which is the main thing he uses, and will help me clean up the floor with it. The mop is simply braided rope which was a little unhappy about, would be better if it was unbraided, with smaller chains rather than a few bulky pieces. The stand works good, but it is difficult for him to be able to loop in over so the toys tend to be left on the floor, but he's 18 months old so its to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: My 1 year old son loves his new cleaning set!
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old son loves his cleaning set! I had to get him this because he would always help me sweep and mop. He use to take over when I would start swiffering! He needed something his size so we could get the job done! I love the rack it really helps to keep it all organize! The only thing that bothers me is the wood handles. I am concerned of potential wood cracks, splinters, and effective cleaning. I was able to wipe everything down with a towel of dawn soap and water then let it all air dry. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: April Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Instant hit
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and it was an instant hit! My first thought: Now I can sweep without arguing over the broom! See the picture We swapped brooms to clean up her dinner mess and the broom worked better than I expected. The bristles are firm and the handle feels like solid wood. After our swap, baby girl thinks the big broom is for her and the tiny broom is for mama...yeah right Overall, the set looks and feels good. I hope to get a lot of use out of it
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This set arrived to my grand daughter very quickly. I know it was recommended for 3 and up , but at 18 months, she was already using Mom's which I thought could pose more of a danger. Because Mellisa and Doug is such a superb brand, I decided to go ahead give it a try. She seemed so excited, she didn't know what to use first. I received a picture of her mopping and sweeping the kitchen floor at the same time. lol. Her mother said she was "multi-tasking'" . What great fun for a budding little helper!
customer_reviews.author: Paula Jo

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my toddler who insists on grabbing the broom when we’re sweeping, so I figured he can have his own size that’s more efficient. I love the set and that it comes with a stand, but the stand is a bit wobbly. I also wish they connected to the stand in a more toddler-friendly fashion, but that’s really reaching. A couple broom fibers have fallen out in the first couple weeks, but still a reasonable amount. Overall, I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, feels like unfinished products
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my toddler as he loves to grab the big one, this one is not that great. It's wooden handles feel rough and not smooth at all. The brushes (both of them) came with their brush part bent and wouldn't get straight no matter how many times i tried. The mop is the worst as it has the plastic thing at the bottom and not too many cloth part so if a kid is going to mop it will leave scratch marks. It could've been better had they finished the wooden parts properly.
customer_reviews.author: Arslan

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I’m returning this. The broom broke right off of the handle the day we got it, and my son barely even used it before it broke. He literally swept it gently across the floor twice before it fell off. The rest of it looks flimsy as well. Will stay away from this brand in the future. It’s not like it was inexpensive either.
customer_reviews.author: Celgirl27

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great little gift. My 17 month old is constantly trying to "steal" my regular broom and copy me when I clean. So ai bought this for him for an early Christmas gift. He LOVES IT!! Plays with it all dsy and carries the broom everywhere. The ONLY issue I had was the plastic part of the box it came it looked like someone put their fist through it and shattered it. Not a big deal none of the toys inside were affected. Could easily have been a shipping error 🤷. The product was worth it though!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 3 year old who likes to help me clean. She loves it, my 10 month old and 8 year old also play with it just as much! My 8 year old has actually dusted with the duster, which I wouldn’t recommend, especially with 2 dogs, living in NW US, lots of rain, the bring in mud. It got very dirty, the only downfall is that I can’t just wash the duster! So I’m going to buy a real one to add to this set. But it’s reasonably priced and well made!
customer_reviews.author: Karissa

customer_reviews.title: Mop Broke Quickly
customer_reviews.text: You can pretend that kids are always going to use this to gently clean their imaginary house, but honestly there will be a little broom hockey going on at some point and that should be expected with a kids' toy. The set isn't super sturdy and the mop broke almost immediately (these are three year olds so there wasn't much force involved). Melissa and Doug is usually really well made so this set is the exception to their normal quality standards.
customer_reviews.author: itsmepkb

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sturdy, I don't worry about my 2 year old being hard on it. Nice Stand to keep everything together Looks real Cons: As others have stated the hard plastic piece on the inside of the mop will scratch hardwood floors, which sort of defeats the point of having it. My 2 year old has decided i is just as fun to play swords with it with his older brother, than to "clean" with it, and being that it is made of wood, it's not really a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Toddler tools that actually work.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for REAL cleaning tools for my 18 month (now 2yo). The duster is GREAT ( I sometimes use it myself). The dustpan and hand broom are very good (also use it myself sometimes). The mop is good at soaking up water spills. The broom is the only thing that really has the functionality of a toy. Its bristles are so flexible that it's hard for my toddler to not just mush it into the ground. Everything is a good size for a little toddler. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: AML

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Proof
customer_reviews.text: Great item! My daughter, 3, loves to do anything I do. And while she isn't great at it it is a great learning tool that one day she will master. As these are in the hands of my 3 year old they've been beaten, thrown, stepped on, you name it ! And they are still looking good and when used properly clean rather well! The stand is rather nice to have also. There is a little indent so each tool and nicely sit onto the stand without worry of my destructive toddler breaking a plastic piece it snaps into. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Cornish Family

customer_reviews.title: Real cleaning tools, just kid-sized!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and perfect size. She feels just like a grown up! My 5 year old daughter loves to help around the house and saved up her chore money for weeks to buy this for herself. The freestanding rack is awesome-she put it right beside mommy’s cleaning stuff so she runs right over and gets hers when I’m cleaning. The pieces are all very realistic and work very well for actual cleaning. She sweeps and dusts with me and loves every minute of it!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. B

customer_reviews.title: Dust pan works better than mine!
customer_reviews.text: My 14 month old daughter loves this! I thought it would keep her from trying to grab my broom while I swept but now she just wants both... lol! What are you going to do? Anyways, it’s well built and actually the dust pan and sweeper works better than my adult version. I love the little hanging station it comes with. It keeps everything neat and tidy! Would highly recommend! It’s a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley E. Voortman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Montessori toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My 16-month-old has always wanted to help by grabbing the broom, dust pan, rags, etc. with this set she is able to help me with the perfect sized tools. We like the wood handles and the variety of cleaning tools. The stand is great. We keep it in the dining room and honestly, I’ve used these to clean up messes as they’re conveniently right there. We try to follow Montessori principles so we let her do a lot independently and this is perfect to allow that. Works well. No complaints this far.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little helpers!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves to play with the big broom, but it sometimes knocks him over because of its weight. Looked up broom for kids and found this product. I love Melissa and Doug items and have used them for years as I am a behavior analyst and work with kids. He absolutely LOVES every item in the package! The stand is great, but my son likes to use it as a weapon and swing it around so I glued suction cups to the bottom so that it stays in place. Would definitely recommend this item for any little cleaners out there!
customer_reviews.author: TheMommyLook

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad shipping
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. So far it’s sturdy, even for my wild little toddler. He gets to help clean and I get to get some actually cleaning done. Win win. The reason for the three stars is because the packaging cane extremely damaged and the products inside were loose. This was a Christmas gift for my son, so I sent it back and purchased from target. The product is 5*, the shipping and handling...not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: I've bought three of these!
customer_reviews.text: We go this for our daughter when she was a toddler so that she could sweep and follow us around the house and not break things by awkwardly carrying a broom that was more than two times longer than she was. She loved them and she STILL plays with them, even as an eight-year-old who has actual chores around the house. I just bought this for my nephew (2) and niece (18 mos) and they're using them just as much as my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Ravellette

customer_reviews.title: Great play set!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great 'play' set. Our boys are 2 and love helping me sweep and pretend to mop and dust. While I say help sweep it's more like push the dirt and crumbs around while I actually sweep lol I dont think you can actually mop with the mop at least I'm not going to try or let them. That doesn't mean one day they may just do it anyway lol. The duster is cool but if they do dust with it I dont really think its cleanable....not sure they haven't gotten it dirty enough to the point where I want to try and clean it yet. Great product! Keeps the kids occupied sometimes when I'm trying to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Larock

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product for children!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Our 2 year old daughter wouldn’t quit walking around the house knock over things with our full size broom so we bought her these. They are perfect. They’re exactly the right size for her, they are very well made and the stand is compact for nice storage in a corner. Such a great teaching tool as well when trying to show a child how to clean up after themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi F.

customer_reviews.title: Happy 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to our grandson on his 2nd birthday. He loves to find the broom and dustpan at our house, so now he has his own at his. He played with it right out of the box! He had some trouble getting the tools off of the stand, but it didn’t seem to bother him and putting them back on was easier for him. He also has used the rack to hang hats on. :) I really can’t speak for durability as he hasn’t had it that long, but I don’t see anything that we would me think it won’t be. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: wanda

customer_reviews.title: For short kids
customer_reviews.text: The quality is excellent as is usual for Melissa and Doug products. My complaint is that the mop and broom are so short. My 4-year-old granddaughter has to bend over to mop. However, she loves all the parts of the kit, especially the mop. I have been putting a little water in my mop bucket, and she mops away. I will probably buy another longer dowel rod and replace the mop handle.
customer_reviews.author: Joyful Nana

customer_reviews.title: Able to keep 1yo distracted when you need to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought a kids broom set because my 1yo keeps taking my broom while I sweep. This is a good solution so that I can give him his own broom or mop while I clean. Thankfully, he will happily accept this broom set. I did add a clear scratch guard on the bottom of the mop, thanks to previous reviews. The string handles are a little tricky for a 1yo to hang so I still have to help with that. Overall, a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kids with minor quality issues
customer_reviews.text: The product is great and came well packaged. However, the handle of the stand and broom were loose when the product was received. The stand was just a matter of screwing back into place, but the broom might need some glue to make sturdy again. Overall, I think any young child will enjoy having this to play with. The only thing I wish were different is if it came with a standing dust pan rather than the hand dust pan.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Learning Play set.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old daughter LOVED this set as a Christmas gift. I originally saw it at a big box store where the price was a little steeper and the quality seemed a bit less than. After reading helpful reviews and seeing a cheaper price, I purchased this set. Although the plastic covering the front of the box was broken, it was all in great condition. My daughter loves to clean even more now. The wooden quality gives such a nice feeling knowing that it will last. Another Melissa & Doug hit, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeter

customer_reviews.title: So cute and "useful"
customer_reviews.text: This set was purchased for 20-month-old twin granddaughters who were constantly stealing their mom's adult-size broom to clean up the messes they made in the kitchen. Use your imagination to picture what that was like. This set has led them to clean up not only the kitchen but the entire outdoor area in their purview as well. Their only complaints are that the mop keeps getting knotted up with twigs and for some reason the dust pan won't just magnetize dirt. Facing staggering odds, they're doing their little girls' best. Super cute and sturdy set--glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia P

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality and my baby Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our 18 month old got this for Christmas becuase she's always trying to clean and these are perfect size for her! She literally just carries the mop around everywhere. She used the dogs water bowl to get water to mop the floor just last week! 🤦🏼‍♀️ However, she loves this whole set and it's very well made! The bristles are soft on the brushes and the mop head feels like a real one! Would absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jes Goss

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Toddler loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My two year old daughter absolutely loves this set. She uses the broom, mop, and dust pan the most. The two brushes are hardly used. She loves to help sweep the floors with her toys and will run to grab her mop if there is water on the floor. The quality is great. If I had one complaint it is that the strings to hang up the toys is a bit small. It is not the easiest to hang on the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: I wish the wood wasnt rough and handle stuck to broomstick
customer_reviews.text: That is my only concern... my kid loves it, I just wish it had a clear coat on top to protect from splinters after a few drops to the ground and cat chasing... and the dustpan doesnt hook onto the broom like real ones do. So my toddler sees me sweeping with the dustpan stuck against the broom stick, and he tries to copy and gets frustrated when it falls...
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Kid is happy so I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: My nephew has this set and when my 18mo son went to visit him, my son was obsessed. I ordered this afterwards and I am generally pretty happy. I love that there isn't a bunch of plastic and the price point was nice my only complaint was that the rod that holds the items is bent, so the holding rack wobblies. My SIL isn't like this so I just got a fluke blemished one. Also the loops that are used to hang the tools are smallish so it's hard for little ones to get the m on and off the stand without help.
customer_reviews.author: DRR

customer_reviews.title: Previously opened box
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to give as a gift and while the set was all there and intact, the box had obviously been opened (all the twist ties holding the items in had been undone or were missing and the cardboard holding them inside the box was ripped up) and the cleaning set had been crammed back into the box. I like the cleaning set and it looks very sturdy. If was not as sturdy as it is, given the state of the box, it could have been worse I guess. I wish I had been given a heads up that this had been a returned item.
customer_reviews.author: Zenaiah

customer_reviews.title: Our Grandson Loves This
customer_reviews.text: Our son in law is alway sweeping so when we saw this set (his mothers suggestion) we bought it for his 1 year birthday. (He is pretty tall and walked early, so it wasn't too early of a gift based on age) He is now 15 months and is constantly sweeping the floor with the broom! It's so much fun watching him and seeing how he is following their footsteps. Best part is he is learning early to clean up after himself. We would highly recommend this set for a child. The quality is great and it really works.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ann Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it! But my broom fell apart.
customer_reviews.text: My boys love this! I would give it 5 starts except that the broom head has fallen off the handle. So now I have to glue it back together. Which is disappointing after researching the kids broom sets and spending money on a Melissa and Doug product. I love the brand. But I’m disappointed that this happened. My boys love this toy so much that they often “help” me clean by sweeping. My youngest is 19 months old and he will go get the dust pan from this set when I sweep with the adult sized broom.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Binns - Craven

customer_reviews.title: Best. Toy. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and buy your kids this set! We initially saw these while doing our newborn shoot and my two older ones loved it! It kept them occupied during points where they weren't being photographed which was a lifesaver! So I wound up buying it for them for Christmas, and 6 months later it still gets played with almost everyday. Not only that but it helps me out when they are "play" sweeping up the floors and wind up actually cleaning for me :) while being educational for real life everyday activities. So essentially this is the greatest most useful toy I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: NYer523

customer_reviews.title: Minus the mop, this is a 5 star toy.
customer_reviews.text: I usually love the quality of M&D toys, so I was surprised to find such a terrible mop in this set. Every time my daughter uses it pieces of yarn shed off, and sometimes whole pieces of yarn fall out. The other pieces are all lovely, great little kid sized tools. The mop is the only piece that cannot actually be used. And when it is used for pretend mopping, it makes a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Marla Singer

customer_reviews.title: Learn life skills
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old daughter. She immediately grabbed the broom and started sweeping. I clean everyday and she likes to follow me around "helping" me. I love how engaging this toy is. It's like an actual cleaning set made for small babies! I love this toy and recommend buying it to teach your child that cleaning can be fun! Will add a photo tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Aila

customer_reviews.title: I love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: My son is forever stealing my broom and trying to sweep the floor. He's always mimicking cleaning, he loves to clean! So I thought I'd get him this awesome realistic mop and broom set. He loved it instantly.... But ultimately he prefers the big broom. Silly kid. Oh well. The toy is very well made. I even purchased open box. Everything was there. There was no damage on item, only a cut on the box. I love Melissa and Doug, I know the quality is always there.
customer_reviews.author: MumSamurai

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy set
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our toddler because she is very interested in "helping" us clean. Unfortunately, she prefers the life-size version so I didn't serve its intended purpose. (Had to buy a second broom so she could "help".) On the plus side, when her cousins visit they play with it, so it is getting some use. Great set though.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hetchler

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, perfect gift for teaching the littles how to tidy up!
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting this item to be so sturdy and so darn cute. I bought this for my niece's birthday, as she has turned two and loves to help clean around the house. This has been the absolute perfect birthday gift for her. It is the perfect size for her to use at her age and the sturdiness of the pieces ensure that this little set will last for years. This has been worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Miss McCool

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves to clean now.
customer_reviews.text: This set of cleaning toys is great for my two year old. The pieces are sturdy and actually work to some extent. My daughter sometime picks up the broom and duster and walks all over the house "cleaning". The holder is a huge plus as it helps keep things tidy. It's also a way to teach her to put things away in their proper place.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and surprisingly Fun for Kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my grandchild, who is attending Montessori, would have a way to pretend to help out at home. But amazingly, both she (who is 3) and her brother (who is 18 months) fight over this and they genuinely want to use them properly. They don't think that they ARE pretending, they think they are helping. I think that the high quality wood and realistic look of them makes them seem like adult items and not toys to the children. They have been a real hit and the stand makes it easy to store them wherever you think they will be used, such as the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Workman

customer_reviews.title: Great set - sad the packaging impacted the quality
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with the quality and size. It's perfect! The reason for 4 stars is that the brush arrived damaged (but usable). I got frustration free packaging, and I was disappointed that the product was damaged. I didn't issue a return it replacement because it was too much of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen Hayman

customer_reviews.title: Wood handles are not smooth!
customer_reviews.text: Product looks great. However every handle was rough to the touch. Had to take extra time to sand down every handle so they were smooth for our child to use. Melissa and Doug products are usually great but this time I think they needed more quality control on this particular product.
customer_reviews.author: Dunnzo

customer_reviews.title: Wow can't believe this came like this
customer_reviews.text: Wood splitting and paint chipping I'm so surprised this came like this going to find out if they will send a new base. Plus broom was bent after paying as much as I did for this it should have not came like this.hard to believe Melissa and Doug came like this. They usually have the best kids toys. Can't believe I giving this a one star :( hope they fix this so I can give a 5 star
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to get your littles involved!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect little play toy for my 17 month old daughter who always wants to be involved in my cleaning throughout the day! The only con is it’s very flimsy! The bristles are not sturdy and the material on the duster will likely fall apart with little use. But personally, I think she will get quite a bit of use out of it with gentle play and appreciation of her toys :)
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: First "toy" to keep them busy all day!
customer_reviews.text: I guess the babies really want to sweep! My 1 year olds are excitedly playing with this set - the broom is the favorite followed closely by the stand. The other pieces are not of interest so getting 2 brooms would probably be better but the set is of good quality and perfect size and weight for little ones. Now to get them to not eat what they sweep up...
customer_reviews.author: phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend, great quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nearly-two-year old son for Christmas so he would stop stealing our giant adult sized broom 😄 Worked beautifully, he loves the entire set, and the brooms and dustpan really do work! Very sturdy, and I love the stand- keeps everything together with a very small footprint. All visiting kids also love playing with it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alice W Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product and very well made
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES this toy! She was obsessed with “helping” us clean and would get upset when we’d put things away so now she can use her own broom and mop. It is a little on the heavy side so be careful when the stand tips but it’s very sturdy. I’d definitely recommend and would even buy as a gift for someone!
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I'm unhappy with the items because the mop has a screw in the middle and it only has tassels around the rim, there is nothing in the middle. I have seen real small brooms before but these items are too small for my 3 and 4 year old. They are hardly usable. I think they need to adjust the design to actually be usable especially since such sizes already exist. Instead it's more of a fake toy and too small for a 3 and 4 year old.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeLove

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 18 month old!
customer_reviews.text: My little guy has been loving playing housework with me. AKA every time he seems me cleaning, he wants to help with the broom or vaccuum. This set is amazing and super cute. My little man will "help" me broom up and clean up around the house. Even my 5 year old niece loves it for playing house. Its a must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Great Teaching Tool and Play Toy
customer_reviews.text: This cleaning set has been amazing for both my one year old and my eight year old. Both enjoy being able to help me “clean” the house! The broom, brush, mop, and dusted are well made and sturdy. The dust pan is plastic, but has held up well to repeated droppings. The storage stand is fairly decent as long as you fast then plastic tightening disc on the bottom. If you don’t, it does lean toward one side. Overall, a super cute set that makes a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Euchrechic1211

customer_reviews.title: Good helping toy
customer_reviews.text: I like this item it’s a good toy for kids who want to help. My daughter loves to help but she’s younger than the recommended age for this toy she’s 20 months and got it for Christmas. She loves trying to help but can’t quite get it right now which is ok. I had to put this in the play room because she kept knocking it over in the kitchen and it was a trip hazard. Maybe when she gets older we will put it back in the kitchen so she can help.
customer_reviews.author: MGT33

customer_reviews.title: Your kids will LOVE this!!
customer_reviews.text: Always impressed with Melissa & Doug, but this is by far one of their BEST products!! The kids LOVE it and what’s better is they can actually use the cleaning tools to ... CLEAN! My kids love grabbing their broom, duster, or mop and helping out. From when my kids were 2 years old up to my 9 year old, they have both loved it. The age gap doesn’t seem to matter. I would gift this in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Cara Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Love it but broken after 3 days.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 2yr old for Christmas and he LOVES it. It’s a great little set and I love that it comes with a stand. My only complaint is that the broom head has already come off after using lightly for a few days. I’m worried the others will follow suit. I’m going to try to glue back together and hope it doesn’t happen again.
customer_reviews.author: MalPal

customer_reviews.title: Crooked but toddler loves it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves to help clean and this gift was perfect!! Only had one issue that ruined for me but not for my daughter who loves it. The pole that holds the broom/mop doesn't screw in correctly to the base so it's crooked. I have to make sure I place the heavier cleaning stuff on the side that's not crooked to balance it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Love this set so much. However, I purchased for my 2.5 and 1.5 year olds. They more often use these as weapons instead of pretend to clean with them. The pieces are real wood which allows my crazy people to be extra crazy. The babes can play with them for short periods of time before they're taken away and hidden, lol. Hopefully in older years they'll be more adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my soon to be 2 year old grandson. It is very durable and sturdy. He loves it. He rides the stand like a stick horse but uses all of his cleaning aids for cleaning for the most part. Other times he used the broom like a hockey stick hitting a ball. However he chooses to play with it he seems to enjoy it and I believe it will last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Szabo

customer_reviews.title: Very cute except the wood on the handles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my niece and she absolutely loves it. She is always trying to clean like her mother so having something her size is awesome. I loved everything about it except the handles. The handles are rough and I'm afraid that she would get a splinter from it so her father sanded the handle down then painted it. Its very cute, I just wish the handles were smoother.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lai

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my kids as a gift to go with their kitchen set. Box that hold the set came in completely damaged but the shipping box it came in wasn’t. So assuming it was sent that way. Kind of sad that they had to open a gift that was broken but it was fine. First world problems lol. Still a great gift and fun for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!
customer_reviews.text: I got this a month ago for my 1 year old (almost 16 months now). I read the reviews about it not being up to Melissa and Doug standards, but took the risk anyway. I haven't had any quality problems and my son loves every bit of it! The biggest issue he's had has been getting whichever tool he wants off the stand. I have to show him daily to lift it up instead of pull it straight towards him. That's definitely an age thing, and I expect him to get the hang of it soon!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Feagin

customer_reviews.title: Love this set!
customer_reviews.text: My (very petite) 21 month old daughter LOVES this set. She is so happy and proud to be able to "help" me clean around the house. You can't beat the quality of Melissa and Doug products, and this set is no exception. Made of smooth wood, it is easy to assemble and use. It is sturdy and clearly made of durable materials. As a former Montessori teacher I consider this a must have for everyone with toddlers!
customer_reviews.author: Grace Kerrigan

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous to buy these after reading some bad reviews. We've only had it open for 2 days but my son is in love with it!! The stand is straight and isn't uneven as others have experiences. There are some points where paint was accidentally put on other pieces but I don't mind. My only complaint is that while taking the items out of the box I got a splinter. I am going to find a wood sealer/finish to put over it to eliminate chances of splinters.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Horn

customer_reviews.title: great, inexpensive gift for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: My toddler has enjoyed playing with this toy. It is sturdy and well made. One small quibble - the loops on the tools that are used to hang them from the stand are too tight. It is difficult for her to take them on and off the stand. I'll probably try to cut them off and replace them with slightly looser loops - I just need to find some strong twine.
customer_reviews.author: mtparadigm

customer_reviews.title: Get it now! As soon as they start to grab the broom!
customer_reviews.text: I know it says best for 3 year olds but my 18 month old loves this. She finally leaves our brooms alone and just runs to go get hers when I'm cleaning. The moment you see your little one starting to grab the broom or mop GET THIS. She will even put it back on the hooks even though it took her a little to learn how to do it because the yarn doesnt have much length to easily do it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 14 month old just loves to follow me around the house and steal my broom while I'm cleaning. So, I figured, I'd get one that was made for a toddler! He just loves this set! He totes it around, sweeping the floor, dusting the furniture (and often the dog) with the dust mop, mopping the floor. He is technically younger than the recommended ages for this, but he is walking and was busy stealing mine, so I figured he could handle it. I love that it's made from real wood! It doesn't feel cheap, like most of his other toys tend to feel. I would definitely buy this again!!
customer_reviews.author: HK Knotts

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for little helpers
customer_reviews.text: Our little helper was always trying to use a broom way too big for himself, so we got him some supplies his own size! Melissa and Doug make some truly great stuff, and this is no exception. Everything is well built and does not feel cheap at all. Your helper can actually sweep, dust, and pretend to mop with you and actually help. The stand stores easily in any corner and each item hangs nicely. If you have an eager little helper, this is the perfect item to encourage and teach them how to help around the house!
customer_reviews.author: MC2

customer_reviews.title: It's meh... Loops are not easy for kids to use
customer_reviews.text: The loops (at the end of the handles) in the cleaning set are hard for kids to use especially when they're trying to put the set back or pull it from the stand. It can be very frustrating for kids that it's almost a deterrent for them to play with this. The dust pan is also not that good for catching smaller pieces when kids try to use it with the broom. Would I recommend this? I'd say meh...
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Kid sized cleaners.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for granddaughters. Ages 7 and 4. They really wanted a house cleaning set for their playhouse. They seem to enjoy using the cleaning tools. All of the tools look and work like adult sized, sturdy wood and cloth. NOT plastic junk. I would recommend this for any child who likes to help around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sctyb25

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Only down side is the loop on the tops should be bigger. Right now it's tricky for me as an adult to get them back on the stand. But my 16 month old doesn't mind. He leans them against the wall. The stand is very sturdy though. And these really all work for real cleaning. But best of all my son loves them so so soooo much! Thanks grandma!!!
customer_reviews.author: RobC

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Dust, Sweep And Mop
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThis six-piece play set gives kids all the housekeeping tools they need to keep it clean! Sized just for kids and built to last, the broom, mop, duster, dustpan, and hand brush are comfortable to use and easy to store--just hang them from the sturdy cords on the included stand for neat, compact storage. (The dustpan can also snap onto any of the handles.) Natural-wood handles add durability and a classic look; bright pops of color keeps lots of fun in the mix! Re-imagine the everyday and make big imaginations feel right at home with this sturdy, kid-sized cleaning set! Solid wood handles offer top quality for years of playing house and give the set a classic, realistic look. The long-handled broom and handy hand brush have soft bristles to sweep gently over all surfaces. A colorful duster features reinforced fibers that won’t fall out, and the durable dustpan snaps onto any of the other handles. All of the pieces have hanging loops to store the pieces on the wooden upright stand, making it easy to clean up after cleanup! Playing house is a great way for kids to develop confidence and responsibility in a playful way! Hands-on pretend play with the Dust! Sweep! Mop! play set helps kids develop fine motor skills, encourages them to get up and moving, and helps foster creativity and imagination. Mimicking everyday chores helps teach responsibility and boosts self-esteem. Kids love playing house independently or using this set alongside adults. The stimulating hues of red, orange, green, and blue offer learning opportunities for color recognition as children identify each tool. This classic set, with its realistic, kid-friendly features, is sure to become a go-to favorite for imaginative and enriching play. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.
feature_bullets: INSPIRES HOURS OF PRETEND PLAY: We developed the Dust! Sweep! Mop! Pretend Play Set to motivate your child to model independence and use their imagination to have fun! Each cleaning tool gives them an imagined role and pretend task to try.

REALISTIC WOODEN CLEANING TOYS: This colorful, kid-sized set looks just like the real thing and includes a wooden pretend play broom, mop, duster, brush, and organizing stand. The red dustpan conveniently clips into all handles.

BUILDS SKILLS AND CONFIDENCE: This skill-building and confidence-boosting set is designed to strengthen and embolden your child’s sense of purpose. Each pretend play tool helps them develop coordination and fine motor skills.

GREAT FOR AGES 3-6: Our kid-tested and timeless toys make great gifts for encouraging screen-free, hands-on, and open-ended play. These toys are designed for kids to come back to again and again as they discover new possibilities.

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100% HAPPINESS GUARANTEE: We design every toy to the highest quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts. If your child is not inspired, give us a call and we'll make it right. Our phone number is on every product!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars13,658 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
